docs.snippet: The leader of Venezuela's opposition coalition, Ramon Aveledo, resigned on Tuesday after a five-year stint in which he united fractious politicians but failed to end socialist rule....
docs.lead_paragraph: The leader of Venezuela's opposition coalition, Ramon Aveledo, resigned on Tuesday after a five-year stint in which he united fractious politicians but failed to end socialist rule.

headline.print_headline: U.N. Says 'Enough Is Enough' After Another Gaza School Attack
headline.main: U.N. Says 'Enough Is Enough' After Another Gaza School Attack

docs.snippet: After another deadly attack on a U.N. school in Gaza sheltering Palestinians from fighting between Israel and Hamas militants, the United Nations declared "enough is enough" on Wednesday and asked - when civilians are warned to leave, where do the...
docs.lead_paragraph: After another deadly attack on a U.N. school in Gaza sheltering Palestinians from fighting between Israel and Hamas militants, the United Nations declared "enough is enough" on Wednesday and asked - when civilians are warned to leave, where do they go?

headline.main: Tax Inversions Spinning Out of Control

docs.snippet: Hospira’s potential $5 billion deal for a Danone unit highlights a variation on inversions: “spinversions.” The odd combination, says Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews, also reflects the perverse incentives distorting corporate decisions...
docs.abstract: Hospira’s potential $5 billion deal for a Danone unit highlights a variation on inversions: “spinversions.” The odd combination, says Robert Cyran of Reuters Breakingviews, also reflects the perverse incentives distorting corporate decisions.

headline.print_headline: Vatican Taking Action in Divisive Paraguay Diocese
headline.main: Vatican Taking Action in Divisive Paraguay Diocese

docs.snippet: Pope Francis is taking action in a divisive diocese in Paraguay where an Argentine priest, accused by a former superior of being a "serious threat to young people," has been removed as the No. 2....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis is taking action in a divisive diocese in Paraguay where an Argentine priest, accused by a former superior of being a "serious threat to young people," has been removed as the No. 2.

headline.print_headline: Ohio: 2nd Fine Levied Against Prison Food Vendor
headline.main: Ohio: 2nd Fine Levied Against Prison Food Vendor

docs.snippet: The state on Wednesday announced a second fine against the private vendor that took over the job of feeding inmates last year as the company defended its operations before a prisons oversight committee....
docs.lead_paragraph: The state on Wednesday announced a second fine against the private vendor that took over the job of feeding inmates last year as the company defended its operations before a prisons oversight committee.

headline.print_headline: Russia Says U.S. Accusations Over Nuclear Treaty 'Unfounded'
headline.main: Russia Says U.S. Accusations Over Nuclear Treaty 'Unfounded'

docs.snippet: Russia on Wednesday dismissed Washington's accusations that it has violated the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Treaty as "unfounded", and said it had its own complaints against the United States over the treaty....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia on Wednesday dismissed Washington's accusations that it has violated the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Treaty as "unfounded", and said it had its own complaints against the United States over the treaty.

headline.print_headline: Obama to Republicans: ‘Stop Just Hatin’ All the Time’
headline.main: Obama to Republicans: ‘Stop Just Hatin’ All the Time’

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama took his criticism of congressional Republicans to a higher pitch on Wednesday, imploring them to  "stop just hatin' all the time" as they voted to sue him over charges he has overstepped the bounds of his office....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama took his criticism of congressional Republicans to a higher pitch on Wednesday, imploring them to  "stop just hatin' all the time" as they voted to sue him over charges he has overstepped the bounds of his office.

headline.main: Detective Injured in Greenwich Village Shootout Leaves Hospital

docs.snippet: Mario Muniz, the New York police detective who was injured in a shootout Monday in Greenwich Village, was released from Bellevue Hospital Center on Wednesday....
docs.abstract: Mario Muniz, the New York police detective who was injured in a shootout Monday in Greenwich Village, was released from Bellevue Hospital Center on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: New Haste in Mortgage Settlement Negotiations
headline.main: Bank of America Raises Its Mortgage Settlement Offer

docs.snippet: The bank and federal prosecutors have accelerated their negotiations to resolve an investigation into the bank’s sale of toxic mortgage securities before the financial crisis....
docs.abstract: The bank and federal prosecutors have accelerated their negotiations to resolve an investigation into the bank’s sale of toxic mortgage securities before the financial crisis.
